text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to note that the court can refuse to act if it does not consider it appropriate to do so because the seat of arbitration is outside England & Wales. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this by stating that the court will be careful to respect the arbitration agreement and the competence of the arbitral tribunal/seat court, and discusses how the court balances comity and the seat (Singapore) against English relief, including considering whether relief in Singapore would be available and effective.
